title: Executive Dean and Professor
text:
★ View Employer Profile 
Saxton Bampfylde Reference: KAPJA 
Northumbria University, Newcastle is a research-rich, business focussed, professional university with a global reputation for academic excellence. Located in Newcastle upon Tyne, and with a recently opened campus in the heart of London’s financial district, Northumbria University has a base in the UK’s best two cities for students and also has extensive activity overseas, in China, Grenada, Hong Kong, India, Indonesia, Malaysia and Singapore. 
With an outstanding result in REF2014, Northumbria was the UK’s largest riser in research power and now enjoys a top 50 position for research. The University has the highest level of student entry qualifications of any modern university, in addition to strong student satisfaction, quality home and international recruitment, and high-performing collaborations and partnerships at home and overseas. The University is seeking to further develop its standing in teaching and research by appointing an exceptional Professor and Executive Dean for its Faculty of Health and Life Sciences. 
As Executive Dean of the Faculty of Health and Life Sciences you will provide disciplinary and wider leadership and vision for the Faculty and contribute personally to building the University’s reputation and ranking. You will lead and direct the Faculty’s activities, and drive performance to achieve transformational change within the context of the University’s Vision, Corporate Strategy, plans, policies and procedures. 
You will demonstrate strong and effective strategic leadership and have a strong track record in research commensurate with the University’s future ambitions and proven track record of driving sustained success. You will possess the academic credibility to lead the Faculty and its disciplines and activity. You will work with colleagues across the Faculty and University to create and develop strategic partnerships and networks to enhance collaboration, particularly in research. 
As an academic member of the University’s Executive, you will be responsible for contributing to the development, delivery and promotion of the University’s Vision, Corporate Strategy and supporting plans. 
This post offers an exciting opportunity to join a dynamic and innovative institution with genuine global ambition. 
For further information about the role and details about how to apply, please refer to our employment agency advisors, Saxton Bampfylde at www.saxbam.com/jobs , using reference KAPJA or send an email to KAPJA@saxbam.com . Alternatively, please telephone on +44 (0)20 7227 0890 during office hours. Applications should be received by noon on 16 th November 2015. 
Northumbria University is an equal opportunities employer and in welcoming applications from all sectors of the community we strongly encourage applications from women and under-represented groups.
